cards.back: A disturbance that transfers energy through a medium or space without transferring matter.
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.back: The maximum displacement of a wave from its equilibrium position. Determines wave intensity.
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.back: The distance between two consecutive points in phase on a wave (e.g., crest to crest).
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.back: The number of complete wave cycles per second. Measured in Hertz (Hz).
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.back: The time for one complete wave cycle. Period = 1/Frequency.
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.front: Explain the concept of Wave Speed
cards.back: The speed at which a wave travels through a medium. Wave Speed = Frequency Ã— Wavelength.
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.front: Explain the concept of Transverse Wave
cards.back: A wave where particles vibrate perpendicular to the direction of wave travel (e.g., light waves).
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.front: Explain the concept of Longitudinal Wave
cards.back: A wave where particles vibrate parallel to the direction of wave travel (e.g., sound waves).
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.back: The interaction of two or more waves. Constructive interference increases amplitude; destructive decreases it.
cards.subject: Physics - Waves

cards.back: The phenomenon where a system vibrates at maximum amplitude at its natural frequency.
cards.subject: Physics - Waves
